Even and consistent grind. Perfect. Don't worry about the timer. It takes about 5 seconds to grind 20 grams of coffee, so extrapolate from that. I picked it up for $50 through the cyber Monday warehouse deal.

Great value burr grinder creates a very consistent grind (top priority for me). It can go espresso fine or french press coarse, again consistently at the set level. The sound is fine. The build quality is good. My only complaint is the timer; I fill the huge hopper maybe 1/15th full and have to run the unit more than once to make a 8cup pot of coffee. I forget about this very minor annoyance when I inspect the grounds and taste the coffee. I'm happy with the unit.

reviews.reviewTitle: and I really love this grinder
reviews.reviewText: I have had this for months, and I really love this grinder. It produces a very consistent grind whether fine or coarse. The timer feature is awesome for producing similar amounts of grounds from day-to-day, and the glass bin reduces (or eliminates) coffee ground mess that I've found with other grinders. I very highly recommend this product.

Currently got set for a cup of pour over so I just have to hit the button.
Works well, very fast and love that its ground into a glass container.
Only thing I found a bit bothersome was that if the hopper is not half or more full the grounds appear more featherish and not full grounds, almost a bit powdery. Maybe this is due the weight of the remaining grounds exerting pressure on those beans being ground...

I evaluated all coffee grinders in this level and picked the Bodum. I'm so happy with my purchase, it works great and grinds from get fine to coarse with no mess and zero problems. High quality, and easy to use.

reviews.reviewTitle: reduces static electricity, good on-off switch
reviews.reviewText: The glass container that the ground coffee drops into really does reduce static electricity. (Other similar products make these out of plastic, and the static electricity makes them very messy to use.) The on-off switch is another feature that makes using the product a easy (other similar products do not have this feature). The rubber makes it easy to hold securely, it looks good, and it grinds coffee well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use and easy to clean... works great!
reviews.reviewText:
Its nice to find a product that lives up to the "Product Description" and this grinder does. Originally, we thought we would just use it on special occasions with a 'French press' but after three weeks we find it so easy to use that we grind fresh coffee each and every time we brew... two or more times a day. There is never a mess to clean up and there is no waste AT ALL. Having fresh ground beans every time you brew coffee is a treat.

Edit: Have had the Bodum Bistro for over 5 years now and use it daily. It is still going strong with no problems. We couldn't be happier and wanted to pass along a tip we found for cleaning coffee ground residue at the end of the day. Insert a drinking-straw into the opening where the grounds drop into the receptacle. One or two puffs of air will blow any remaining grounds out of the opening in the top where beans enter the grinder. Its surprising how much collects in there!? Jst be sure to position the unit over (inside) a waste bucket b'cuz it can get messy :) We love this thing.

reviews.reviewTitle: For the amount of coffee and the frequency the motor ...
reviews.reviewText: For the amount of coffee and the frequency the motor burned out too quickly. To breakdown after a year and a half this is too expensive. You've nearly bought a rancilio if you buy a replacement. Might as well spend the money on something that will last longer.
Seems cheaply made. Grinds well. No static coffee explosion or anything. But the button to start the grind sticks sometimes, even causing the unit to stop grinding in the middle of grinding.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very, VERY nice home coffee grinder
reviews.reviewText:
I have used the Bodum Bistro coffee grinder for about two months now, and am very happy with this purchase. The grind is quite uniform, and I LOVE the fact that there isn't any of that bitter coffee dust that I got with both of my previous two burr grinders. So why only four stars? A bothersome quirk which has been mentioned elsewhere: the grind time is limited to 20 seconds, with a required 5 minute "cooling off" period afterward. Since 90% of the time I use the freshly ground coffee to fortify my favorite canned coffee, this is usually not much of an inconvenience. However, on those occasions when I want to make a full pot with all fresh-ground coffee, it is a bit irksome. Having said that, I would still heartily recommend this grinder for anyone who loves the taste of freshly ground coffee.
Let me also mention in passing that I received this grinder two days after I bought it, because I used Amazon PRIME. I know this sounds like a commercial, but PRIME saved our sanity this Christmas season.

Very happy with my Bodum Grinder. It looks awesome in our kitchen and provides daily access to fresh-ground beans. I really like the storage container on top. It holds almost a full bag of beans, so you don't need to deal with adding beans each time you want to grind coffee. One small issue is that sometimes beans get stuck in the grinder (especially after you you change the grind setting). It can be tough to find the suspect bean and dislodge it.

This grinder worked well for about 2 months. Then it stopped grinding. The motor worked, but the beans were not making it down the shoot. We cleaned it, and it would work again one or two times. Finally cleaning didn't fix things. The motor would whirl but beans were not being ground. After 6 months the grinder was completely unusable, and we went back to our trusty Krups grinder which has worked like a champ for over 10 year.

reviews.reviewTitle: MAH GAWD - it's like a miracle.
reviews.reviewText:
prior to owning this magical piece of equipment, my wife required that I use an antique, manual-crank hand grinder from her great uncle's german estate. it was terrible. it would take me 20 minutes to grind enough coffee for a full pot. and it was loud. BUT, it did make me appreciate the convenience of an electric grinder, so thats good.
Bodum makes good stuff typically.
was not disappointed in this thing. I essentially worship it. i wake up and press a button. then, boom. ground, fresh coffee.
Returned two Bodum 10903-70US-1 Bistro Burr Coffee Grinders, Electronic. Stylish but very poor quality internals. Both units power on but the grind button failed with in the first few grinds.

I bought this item on Amazon and received it on Jan 7, 2017. Yesterday, February 17th 2017, 10 days after the Amazon return window, the gear that it seems so many others have problems with broke.

I have used this grinder every day since I purchased for one 15 second grind on medium fine setting. Very disappointed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Now it works fine. 100 buck grinder
reviews.reviewText: I use it for espresso....To make it work I took it apart and removed the center bur. Then I inserted a a .8 mm washer to the center bur nut. Now it works fine. 100 buck grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: It does not work, and makes a mess everywhere
reviews.reviewText: I would not recommend this grinder at all, it gets ground up coffee all over the counter. It makes a mess everytime you use it. The glass container does not contain the ground up beans while it's in use. I wish I could return it.
Zero stars! Worst grinder I ever had. Just one big mess when using. Tried to give it several chances. Just missed return window.
I generally like this product. However, the coffee grinder gets stuck if I load coffee beans beyond the half-way mark on the top holder. The motor is not that powerful and jams.

reviews.reviewTitle: Seven plus years old and maybe time for a new one!
reviews.reviewText:
Gosh, I've had this thing for 4 years now, still runs fine. I use it every morning to grind enough for a 15oz mug using a Bodum french press. It does tend to clog up a little, particularly with French roast. I get less coffee through for a given amount of time when I grind French roast. A setting of about 12-13 seconds usually gets me about 20 grams of coffee with non-French roast, about right for my taste. But the timer isn't too precise, particularly if you are running a power hungry appliance on the same circuit - which tends to make the thing run for less time than you set it for. I've learned to wait til the microwave is done heating the water right in my Bodum Brazil French press or in a Bonavita electric kettle before grinding the coffee. (BTW, the microwave method works great, if your French press has no metal. Start with the hottest water that your faucet will deliver. I have a marked line on my French press so I can fill it to the perfect level. You will learn how many minutes and seconds to get a given temperature. I like around 195F, which is 2:10 in my microwave. You won't lose any temperature heating the French press up by heating elsewhere and pouring it in. Then pour in the freshly ground coffee, stir, and wait 4 minutes or so.)

I was using a Bonavita electric kettle to heat the water lately. More precise than the microwave method, but alas the Bonavita failed after less than 3 months (new one on the way under warranty).

I've cleaned it several times by grinding rice.

If I were really picky I would weigh out the beans and grind them all. The 20 second limit hasn't been a real problem for me because I only had a Mr. Coffee for several months before the thermal fuse blew so back to the French press. When I was grinding for the Mr. Coffee I usually limited my grind to 20 seconds, but several times did two grinds in less than 5 minutes (GASP!) with no adverse effects.

UPDATE - still going after 7 plus years but the throughput is diminished. I can only get about 16 g in 20 seconds. I've tried cleaning, rice, etc. Think maybe the burrs aren't sharp anymore, so will probably buy another.

reviews.reviewTitle: but not bad, and I don't see a way around that
reviews.reviewText: No complaints. It does everything it is supposed to, and is continuing to do so 3 years later with almost daily use. Makes a bit of a mess (a few scattered grounds each time you use it), but not bad, and I don't see a way around that.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great little grinder for what it is!
reviews.reviewText:
I'm really enjoying my Bodum Bistro after using it for a few weeks. I received the Bodum pour-over carafe for Christmas and after doing some research on economy / home burr grinders I decided to invest in the matching Bistro conical burr grinder.

Assembly was devastatingly simple. After unboxing it, I think I had it up and running in under a minute.

Functionality is great and simple to use. There's not much to it- an on/off switch, a timer (to control grind "dosing"), a secondary 'on' button to initiate grinding, and the grind setting which adjusts by twisting the bean hopper.

The grind time isn't too fast (which is good. you don't want to heat your beans. slower is better). It takes about 10 or 12 seconds to grind 30-38 grams of beans, which is about 3-4 tablespoons / scoops. Noise level is moderate. Quieter than my blade grinder, but still fairly noisy especially when the hopper is empty and beans aren't being ground. I'd liken it to an air popper or an immersion blender.

Grind consistency is really good, though I'd say the differentiation between grind settings is minute. I find the pour-over setting is too fine and often adjust to be closer to the French-press setting. I don't see why this wouldn't work to make espresso with a pressurized portafilter (might not be fine enough for a bottomless portafilter).

Design is great, construction is decent; you get what you pay for. The body is rubberized, which I find modern and pleasant. The hopper is plastic, which doesn't bother me any as I don't store my beans in there anyways (always measure / weigh your beans! consistency is important! don't rely on the timer, and please don't store your beans in the hopper. use a light-proof / air-resistant container. i use a ceramic croc). The lid to the hopper is decent and serves its purpose (also rubberized, and a sturdy plastic), but again- I don't store my beans in there anyways and it only serves to prevent beans / fines from flying out when in use.

The glass catcher- I don't know if it's just mine, but I find fines / chaff still clinging to the surface despite being advertised to reduce static. Not a big deal though- I just give it a sturdy slam on my rubber trivet and swirl the grounds around to remove some of the fines. I guess after thinking about it, it DOES reduce static. I find I use my coffee brush MUCH less than when I was using my blade grinder. Sometimes I find a tiny bit of grounds falling out of the grinder once I remove the catcher (again, no big deal. just brush them into your hand and into your catcher / filter).

Overall I'm very pleased with this product and it's a SIGNIFICANT upgrade from my Hamilton Beach Custom Grind blade grinder. It's a great little grinder for what it is (an introductory home burr grinder). It's not great (and by great I mean industrial / professional grade quality), but if you're thinking about making the jump between blade to burr grinding (or pre-ground to home grinding) this is a great investment. The difference between cups is glaringly apparent and noticeably better. Not as a negative discourse, but the bottom line is the design is more impressive than the functionality / output, so if you're not keen on how it looks you might get a little more out of your grind settings by springing for the Baratza Encore. I love the way it looks and it gets the job done (and does it well).

I went into the kitchen this Saturday morning at about 7:00AM to make myself my morning Cappuccino. To my mounting horror I discovered that my grinder - which had been failing for some time - had expired. I went back to the computer and looked for a replacement grinder. I ordered the new one at about 10:00AM. It got here about twenty minutes ago at 6:00PM - the same day!!!

I had expected it would have taken a couple days for delivery. I figured maybe Tuesday. But it wasn't days, it was hours. This same day delivery cost nothing extra. It was all part of the Prime service. Free.

I got the white version which looks right on my white counters and for some reason cost less to boot. I took it out of the box and set it up. I set the timer to twenty seconds and got twice as much perfectly ground beans as I needed. I have a Starbucks semi-automatic machine with standard 55mm double sized coffee receptacles. I set the grind size at about three steps from the finest.

So far this is one of the best Amazon buying experiences I've ever had.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best coffee grinder I've ever had......
reviews.reviewText: .....and it should be for the price. Set the time needle and grind size. From there on out just press the start button when you want to make a fresh pot of coffee or adjust the grind time or the grind size for a different brew. I make my two cup French Press brew every morning. Got the grind size and time set just where I want them. Excellent coffee every time.

LOVE this grinder! Pretty quiet for a grinder. I particularly love the glass cup to catch the grounds. Cleanest set up ever for a grinder, really helps control the mess of coffee grinds going everywhere. Well worth the money.

Great little grinder! Set the grind, set the timer, and every time you hit the button, you get the same grind and the same volume. And unlike previous grinders I've had, there are no grinds to clean up off the counter when I'm through.

reviews.reviewTitle: Make Sure You Buy the Extra Warranty!
reviews.reviewText: Loved it while it worked but it just quit without warning one year and one week after purchase. Make sure you get the extra warranty.
I've had this for years now.. Still works fine, nothing wrong. Not the best compared to more expensive grinders(according to expert reviews), but I've been happy with it. It looks cool?

I got the red one before Christmas (very attractive by the way) and have been very happy with its performance. I will say that I understand other peeps' concern about the 20 second thing, but I'm only making coffee for one person, and it works great for that. If you need a machine to pump out more than 20 seconds worth of coffee grinds, I definitely would NOT get this machine because you're going to be grouchy when you have to wait between cycles.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works as advertised (can't speak to longevity yet). Grinds ...
reviews.reviewText: Works as advertised (can't speak to longevity yet). Grinds consistently and quietly. Only complaint is that it leaves a fair amount of grinds in the mechanism, so when you remove the jar, some typically fall out that you'll have to clean up each time (slightly reduced if you tap on the side before removing jar).

reviews.reviewTitle: Good to look at, not easy/nice to use
reviews.reviewText: The plastic container does not fit properly so it gets messy when the coffee is grinding. The gears got stuck with coffee powder and they’re hard to clean. I had trusted Bodum’s product quality and somehow didn’t take it out to use until after the return period. Now it’s too late.

This product was fine for 3 months and then yesterday, Easter, it decided to stop grinding coffee.
At all. No ground coffee. So, since I didn't buy insurance, will have to buy another burr coffee grinder.
Works fine, only issue is it says to wait 5 mins to use grinder every 20 seconds of grinding.., super annoying
Mixed review bc its bigger than expected/wanted. Love how quiet it is and it has great auto settings. I do recommend if you have the space.

I have had this for about two weeks now and it works like a charm. I don't have to measure beans or figure out how long to grind them for because the chart underneath the lid perfectly details what to do. I don't waste beans anymore and I can get the perfect proportion for my french press. I highly recommend this and it's a great price! With the amount of beans I'm no longer wasting, this grinder will pay for itself over time.

I’m giving this item 2 stars, I’ve only had this grinder for 5 months and now I can’t grind my coffee beans and it’s now making some kind of noise. I was really hoping for some that would last longer then 5 months.

reviews.reviewTitle: Save your money. Piece of junk.
reviews.reviewText: This product is a piece of junk. There is a design flaw where there is a gap between the body of the grinder and the ground coffee container so the grounds fly out of the container all over the place. Huge mess.

The Bodum Bistro Electric Burr Coffee Grinder's lowest setting for grind size is still a little fine for my French press. I think there should be options for larger pieces. I don't use the other, finer grind settings at all. 13 seconds is how long it takes to grind beans for my small 4 cup French press. I'm happy with this press and would buy another, but I wish it cost a little less.

reviews.reviewTitle: It does an excellent job grinding bean to right consistency - every time
reviews.reviewText: It does an excellent job grinding bean to right consistency - every time. The timer works very well producing same volume of ground coffee each time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Thought was better than the Kitchen Aid.
reviews.reviewText:
Bought this because I make espresso only, and the Kitchen Aid wasn't doing a fine grind. Love the time-grind, once I found the exaction location on the dial just right for my fine grind and quantity.

Then I found out that the Kitchen Aid could be recalibrated, which I did per the directions. So now I have 2 grinders, but I use the Bodum because it takes far less room on the kitchen counter.
Great grinder...though it has clogged up on me a few times...not sure what I am doing wrong.

reviews.reviewTitle: Beans kept getting stuck in the burr!
reviews.reviewText: I really wanted to like this grinder -- for the first month we had it, it was quiet and ground decent coffee. Then, it started malfunctioning -- beans would get stuck in between the cones of the grinder and the whole thing would stop working. I found this didn't happen on the fine espresso-grind setting but we grind a slightly coarser-than-drip grind for our morning coffee and so it kept happening. Every time I'd have to empty the hopper by turning the whole unit upside down and then replacing the burr plate ... maybe this one was defective but I couldn't be bothered to figure it out, I just returned it.
Grinds well, very uniform. Its footprint doesn't take up much space on the counter. I'd recommend it over other ones I've seen.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does not grind enough coffee at a time for a full pot.
reviews.reviewText: The maximum grind time is 20 seconds, after which you must wait 5 minutes to grind again. In that 20 seconds, it will only grind about 1.6 oz, which is not enough to make an 11 cup pot of coffee. I like to come into the kitchen in the morning, grind & brew my coffee. I do not wish to wait 5 minutes for the motor to cool off. Therefore, this product is not useful to me and I am returning it. On the plus side, I like the glass container for the ground coffee, it does seem to be static free as advertised. This is probably a fine product if you either make small pots or like your coffee weak.
i’ve been using this for 6 months now every morning and it’s wonderful- i thought it had a problem but when i cleaned it out it went back to perfect

I purchased this grinder at same time as french press by same company. This is because french presses recommend coarse ground coffee. I really like how straightforward and easy it is to use this grinder - you can easily adjust the grind by turning dial. It has storage lid on it so you can keep the beans that are unground in it for the next day's grinding. It is also very quiet for grinder. Nicely engineered - I would purchase again.

reviews.reviewTitle: making perfect grinds for my K-cup machine and larger grinds for ...
reviews.reviewText: I bought one in 2012 and it continues to perform flawlessly, making perfect grinds for my K-cup machine and larger grinds for my French press. Oily dark roast never a problem and never clogs. Bought this second one for my wife who prefers the lighter Duncan Donuts coffee, so the new one is side by side with my old one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very Good - Igual que la Ofrecida
reviews.reviewText: Muy Bueno Para Su Precio

This grinder is excellent. It achieves very even grinds even at press pot settings with minimal noise and heat. I cannot attest to the 20 second grind issue, because I never grind enough beans to need that much time. That would take more than 40grams! That's a lot of coffee...

It's not for espresso, it doesn't achieve a fine enough grind. It's not durable, but you shouldn't be hitting it or stressing it anyway. It doesn't hold too much excess grind either, which is great since that's a common complaint.

Keep in mind! Dark or light roasts aren't a problem here, at all...The freshness of the coffee determines how oily the grind will be more than the roast does. What I mean is someone who buys dark roast 8 o clock coffee doesn't know what coffee is supposed to taste like anyway, so don't listen to their negative reviews regarding grind time...they do not understand the process enough.

This is perfect for home chemex, auto drip, and press pot coffee (among others!), espresso is a no go, so you can ignore the entire left half of the grind spectrum!

reviews.reviewTitle: Worked OK... until it died after warranty expired.
reviews.reviewText: It worked fine for a while, although there's a lot of static and it's kind of loud and messy. But it adjusted well and the grind seemed pretty good. But after a couple years it stopped working. It can't be adjusted anymore and the grind is always wrong. It only came with a limited one-year warranty. I'm not sure what the lifespan of a burr grinder is, but for $100, it sure seems like it should be more than two years!
Great grinder for home use. Pour overs and espresso drinks are better with a grinder that has precision capabilities.

reviews.reviewTitle: Save time and buy this machine. No problems, just positives.
reviews.reviewText: After much extensive research online and offline, this seems to be the best grinder money can buy for home use. I am very happy with this aesthetically pleasing purchase. I cannot think of anything negative to say about this product. I also use an Aeropress and make only one or two cups of coffee at a time, so this product is ideal for that as well. Recommended follow up research can be done at coffeegeek.com

reviews.reviewTitle: Burned out and caught fire in my kitchen.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this in October 2013. I did not really start using it on a daily basis until about February. Today, while grinding beans on the espresso setting, it made a slow grinding noise and then stopped. Smoke began emitting from the top of the machine and I quickly unplugged it. It continued to smoke for a good five minutes afterwards and I set it down in my sink in case I needed to douse it. I have been careful to clean this machine out after every use. I have never used beans that were too oily or anything that would be considered anything other than normal use. For a machine to do this after 8-9 months of expected, normal use is unacceptable.
JUNK !!! It lasted 5 months. Bodum has no support for repairs in the USA. I was told to return the product from where I purchased. Past the 30 days for returns with Amazon

So this is a great product, although it arrived with the button broken. I had to take it apart and remove the button, and rig it to work. Besides that it has worked amazing. Although the course grind seems a bit small, however it still works well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quest for the perfect cup of coffee
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this for my dad to aid in his "quest to make the world's best coffee." I looked at a lot of burr grinders, but it was actually the great video review on Amazon that sold me. That guy is right. Great grinder. Easy to use, quiet and makes very consistent grind. My only change would be to have more control on the grinding to stop, rather than only the timer.

My dad loves it! Next step - "there is no X in espresso".......

reviews.reviewTitle: fantastic grinder. this grinder works very well and it ...
reviews.reviewText: fantastic grinder. this grinder works very well and it quiet enough not to wake the whole house in the morning. Plenty of adjustments to grind and time to cover a wide variety of needs. thank you.

I have used this for two days so far and have to say I love the way it is grinding my coffee for my french press. At first I thought that the grind was a little inconsistent with too small of a grind, but it's actually very good. Very little to no silt left at the bottom of my mug. The grinder is pretty quiet. If it's early in the morning on a weekend and the kids are sleeping I might use my hand grinder, but will test this weekend to see if it wakes them, but I don't think it will. The glass receptacle is wonderful as there is no static clean and no mess. It looks like it will be very easy to clean. It took me a few cups to determine how long to set the timer, but for my strongish coffee I have found that 7-8 seconds is perfect. I like how I can fill the hopper and just push the on button and let it go. The only part of the grinder that seems to be cheaply made is the hopper, but if care is taken, I can't see it being broken. It's light, small, attractive. I like the rubberized feel of the unit. It took me a month or so to pull the trigger, but I am glad I did. Also, I was able to order the black one on Amazon for $69.83 and 2 days after I received it, the black one is now $81.68 so that makes it even better. Not sure why, but I notice the silver ($140.19) and gold ($131.34) are much more expensive and can't figure out why. They appear to be the same.
UPD 02/01/2017 - I have now had the grinder about 3 weeks and still loving it. One thing, though, is that it is louder than I first thought. The first time I tried it with the kids sleeping and early morning, I realized how loud it was. My kids can sleep through smoke detectors so it was no problem, but it's louder than I first reported. Also, I thought that the rubberized exterior would show fingerprints and dirt easily, but it's not too bad either.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product, I just wish it could go coarser.
reviews.reviewText: Let me say that I love the look and feel of this machine! The only thing I don't like about it is that the grind cannot go coarser. I personally think that the french press grind setting is to fine, and that is as coarse as it will go. To be fair I am a bit of a coffee snob... if the grinder had a wider range of settings I would not think twice about getting it again! Definitely better than hand grinding.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best coffee grinder I have found
reviews.reviewText: Received this as a gift and it is the best grinder I have ever owned. Does a great job ans is easy to use and very easy to empty and clean. I have since bought a second one for my second residence. The Bodrum has replaced both the Cuisinart (kept breaking) and Braun (too delicate and not well designed) coffee grinders that I used to own.

Wanted to start drinking coffee again, and had to do it the right way (grinder & french press), so purchased this grinder and I am very happy. So far I have only used the coarse grind setting, but it has always come out extremely uniform in size. It does leave a little bit of a mess, but I found that tapping the side of the grinder before removing the dish took care of the vast majority of left overs... Excellent product would buy again
love this, works perfect, and has all the options I wanted in larger ones for a better price.
Great grinder to span the cost gap of "dirt-cheap" and "Holy crap" expensive. I'm happy
Look no further;, solid, accurate grind for all types of makers, quiet as grinders go, doesn’t take up much room as it is quite compact,

reviews.reviewTitle: because I like the grinder just not the mess
reviews.reviewText: From the day I received this each time I removed the cup about a 1/4 teaspoon of grounds drops from the machine and all over my counter. A friend of mine has the same grinder and hers does not do this. I thought this was just how the machine worked but as it turns out I think I just have lemon. Sadly, because I like the grinder just not the mess. Would like to return and/or exchange (in case mine is just a lemon) but no way to do this on amazon.

Best grinder I ever owned. No problem at all getting enough coffee for a typical 12 cup percolators or drip. A little noisy for early morning when family is sleeping. EDITED. 3 YEARS LATER. Three years later with about 20 hrs use it is jambed up. Looking at other reviews it is probably stripped PLASTIC gears. Get a different brand.

reviews.reviewTitle: Initially I was very pleased with this coffee grinder
reviews.reviewText: Initially I was very pleased with this coffee grinder. It was purchased for a vacation home and barely used for a total of 7 months over less than 2 years when it stopped working. I will not purchase this brand again.

reviews.reviewTitle: I had better results off a cheap Mr
reviews.reviewText: It broke after one use. I had better results off a cheap Mr. Coffee product than I did from this one.

Yes - if you like drinking coffee you - must - by a quality burr grinder. It will greatly enhance the flavor of the coffees you drink, with the proper, fresh, grind. This is an excellent model, easy to operate and maintain. I am writing this review after having two models for over 5 years (so I can choose each day between two different roasts). Both continue to work wonderfully.
This product broke after three months of use. Not very sturdy.
This product stopped working and there are no replacement parts for it
Grinds nicely, a good unit for the money. Not really precise, but with some practice it gets the job done. A little loud first thing in the morning.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good price for a burr grinder
reviews.reviewText: Good price for a burr grinder! It is very easy to adjust. We use it for drip grind, french press, and espresso coffee. We've had it for almost a year and it is still working well. A couple of months ago, it was not functioning, but after taking it apart and cleaning the grinds (done easily), it worked great!

LOVED this grinder, as Bodum makes great products, but after using for 2 months we switched from Espresso grind to French Press grind and upon switching back to Espresso found it is still only grinding for a French Press. The Grounds are far to coarse to use in the espresso maker and there is nothing that we are able to do fix it. We switched grinds per the manual and have cleaned it following the instructions provided. Still nothing. Hoping Bodum will come through on their warranty, but we are disappointed to say the least.

I was in the habit of tapping the grounds receiver with a spoon, to encourage all the grounds to fall out into the coffee filter. Apparently that is not a recommended practice, because the thing shattered after a few months of this treatment. I've glanced through the reviews, and I seem to be the only one who has had this problem, but the glass is pretty thin.

The glass receiver is not available as a spare part.

Other than that, I would agree with reviewers who say that this thing is OK, but it has quite a few annoying little design flaws: grounds fall out onto the platform when you remove the receiver, not supposed to change grind selection when hopper full, hopper lid not tight, etc. I think my next grinder will be something different.

reviews.reviewTitle: I marvel at how quietly it works and how nice and smooth my coffee seems
reviews.reviewText:
Mechanical engineer in family marveled at precision stainless steel gears. I marvel at how quietly it works and how nice and smooth my coffee seems! Easy to fine tune grind for French Press and Stove top espresso maker. Timer helps grind the right amount once you decide on grind and time needed for amount you want.
Great value. I no longer wake up whole family with the sound of coffee grinder. the coffee aroma wakes them.
Works great
Great coffee bean grinder, and great price. Grinder effectively grinds beans for expresso to French press and is better than using an manual grinder.

I have truly enjoyed my Bodum grinder. The grinder is certainly a value for what you pay and get. The grinds jar is very solid and very mi inalienable static, so you don't have enough to shake or play with the jar to get your grinds out. The metal burrs are of really solid construction and yet I paid about the same amount that a plastic burr grinder would cost.

Only complaint is the timer and how that operates, but once you learn it becomes irrelevant.

Love it. Would buy Bodum products again.

Died after using less than 2 months. I used it a few times a day, but only ground 1 serving of beans at a time (around 10 seconds of grinding each time). So it didn't fail due to overheating. Amazon is sending a replacement, so we'll see if I have better luck with the replacement.

I bought this product to grind beans for my Chemex drip coffeemaker. It's okay, but the grind size is uneven, and it's almost impossible to clean the leftover grind bits from inside the machine. The end result is coffee that is decent, but definitely not as good as it can be. You see - when the hot water mixes with an imprecise grind, you get some over-extraction and some under-extraction, which greatly affects the taste of the coffee. Also, the leftover grinds sit in the machine night after night, and bits of them fall out with each fresh batch, also affecting the taste. You'll always get these problems to some degree with any product, but I was surprised just how imprecise the grind is on this product. I guess I just have to spend more to get a quality grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quality grinder, perfect for home use
reviews.reviewText:
Mine works great for occasional grinding; we are not coffee "extremists" and just grind some beans once in a while for a treat. This grinder is a beautiful job, and only requires occasional cleaning. However, if you can grind coffee beans without making a mess more power to you!
Highly recommended.

It is a nice grinder. Quieter and faster than the one it replaced. However, you have to remember to change the setting only while it is running. Also, the information claims that the glass(instead of plastic) container for the grounds limits static elctricity from the scattering of gounds, which I found to not be the case. That was the main feature that helped me to decide and this particular grinder, so I am a little disappointed.
I have not had a good espresso since I bought this machine. Machine simply cannot grind that fine. Waste of money sixty days after purchase. Do not buy for Espresso.

So far, the only thing I can complain about is the color. My color was unavailable for a while and I could not wait to purchase.
The grind settings are really accurate. This unit is not as messy as my old one. The only down side is that you can not grind too long. Machine has to rest. Someone already posted this, so I was aware of this feature and I am ok with it.
Works extremely well! My last grinder finally died after five years and there is a big difference between that $30 grinder and this one. I hope that this grinder works for at least five years.
Not happy with the grind indicator, easily changes and hard to keep it in the correct position. It heats up while grinding more then 8oz at a time. It’s price is good for a burr grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good grinder, just okay for espresso.
reviews.reviewText:
This is a nice grinder, very good upgrade from a blade grinder. Grinds coffee evenly, there is a little bit of static, but the silicon lid for the grounds container keeps those in check. Grounds for espresso are a just a little too course, I get better espresso shots when I have the roaster grind the beans for me. Overall for the price I would recommend this grinder, although if you are only going to use for espresso I would look at something else or buy pre-ground coffee.
For the best coffee find a local roaster and get your beans there!
Easy to operate. Sounds what you would expect from a coffee grinder. Cleans up great.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good Burr Grinder - Very Short Grind Time
reviews.reviewText: Nicely built, solid unit. Does a good job grinding beans for drip or French press, however, you can grind for only for 20 seconds, then you must wait five minutes before grinding again. One would think more powerful motor could be used to alleviate this problem. Great glass canister with close fitting lid to contain the ground coffee. Very little mess on your countertop. All in all, it's a good little grinder.
Gives me fresh ground beans daily. Elegant. Best feature: glass container. Wish I'd be able to buy replacement for that but evidently can't so I'm being very careful.

reviews.reviewTitle: A great value despite some drawbacks
reviews.reviewText:
Pros -

1. The Ground is very consistent and uniform. I switch between coarse for french press and semi-fine for my drip coffee, and at both settings there has never been any partially ground pieces or the dreaded "chuncks n' powder" like some other economy grinders I have owned.

2. The build quality for my unit was high. The machine "feels" solid and well made and the grind bin and bean cover fit with a satisfying seal. I owned a black and decker grinder that would spit errant grounds over the counter because the bind just didn't quite fit to the chute. There is NO problem with this as there is a rubber-like top that fits tightly, but not too tightly into the machine.

3. The noise is not bad at all and is better then my previous grinders. I can use it in the morning when I wake up before my gal without waking her up. Perfect.

Cons --

As mentioned by others, there is one flaw to the machine -- as the manual says, you must wait five minutes between grinds so that the burrs can cool down -- as you may recall from high school physics, friction = heat, and so if you don't do this, you will wear out the burr. The problem is that you can grind for a maximum of 20 seconds before the machine needs to rest.

For me, 20 seconds produces slightly more than one french press or about six cups of drip coffee (I like my coffee somewhat "fuerte"). So if you are making several cups, you are going to be waiting to finish the grind. Since I am almost always making coffee for two, this has not been much of a problem, but if you are going to be making large batches, and you don't want to add another five minutes to your grind time, you should invest in a slightly better unit.

Bottom line -

This is your best value at this price point for a burr grinder. It is a great machine and the one that I received was well-made. However, if you are going to be making larger batches of coffee every morning, the maximum that the unit can safely ground at once, may make this a less than attractive option. If that is the case, you should look into other units.

I would buy this again.

Good, consistent grind. I particularly like that there is a separate timer dial that you can set to grind a regular amount of coffee, based on your daily needs. Some other models do not have this convenient feature. It is also relatively quiet and very easy to clean.

reviews.reviewTitle: couldnt ask for a better grind
reviews.reviewText: we purchased this after returning another grinder because it did not grind fine enough for espresso. the bistro is perfect for grinding very fine coffee for home espresso machines. it has a glass grinds jar which is nice because there is NO messy static cofee flying everywhere. it has a real heavy duty steel grinder, not a cheap plastic disc with blades on it ( like other self proclaimed "burr" grinders). i have not had it long enough to see how long it lasts or breaksdown, but i love how it grinds. Biggest downfall is it can only be run for 20 seconds at a time then wait 5 min for cooldown of motor. so if your needing to grind for several coffees at one time, this grinder is NOT for you. the finest setting is too fine for me, i find it perfect espresso grind on the 3rd to 4th setting over from "fine". and in that 20 sec. it will grind enough for 4 shots, or 2 doubles.

I decided to go Burr and as a fan of Bodum - bougth this one. The first one I had got stuck after about the 3rd useage. I took it apart, but couldn't get it back together. After calling Bodum, the wonderful service rep sent me another grinder which I have had for serveral months. Sin of coffee sins - I grind my coffee for the week 1x/wk and store in an airtight container. The difference between the french press and expresso is not as great as I thought it would be, which is a bit of a disappointment. What annoys me is the mess it makes (which may be why I use it 1x/wk (also takes up to much room on my counter and gets stored in a cabinet. There is a lot of clean up after grinding.

To buy or not is an individual decision, and suggest a careful reading of the comments before making a decision.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a very good grinder!
reviews.reviewText: I have never written a review on a product before but this one is worthy of a review. I previously used a Braun burr grinder that was a big disappointment. The coarsest grind was too fine and it was very messy to use. I read the reviews on the Bodum Bistro and decided to take a chance. I am more than satisfied with this grinder. The grind I use is well below the coarsest setting and the grind is consistent with very few fines. The ground coffee receptacle is functional and clean. For single grinds up to 8 or 10 cups, the 20 second timer is adequate. But, the 5 minute wait between grinds can be annoying. That is a small price to pay and I work around it without great difficulty. Price to value - I would highly recommend this grinder for home use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stops grinding after a few weeks
reviews.reviewText: This item worked for a few weeks, then stopped grinding. Contacted Amazon and tried all steps they advised but nothing worked. Bodum advised, “deal with Amazon.” This grinder is cheap and doesn’t last. Save your money and put it towards a better quality burr grinder.

This is the second one we have bought (the first one broke when someone turned the grinder setting while the grinder was running -- this is a big no-no!). It works just as well in turning out a uniform, consistently-sized grind as the last one

Bought this to grind beans for the pour over bar at our cafe. Also for french press grinds. After a month of use, so far so good. Fairly quiet compared to a similar grinder of a different brand that we've had for over 10 years. This Bodum grinder was recomended to us. I'm glad we got it. May get another soon.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great-tasting coffee grounds and very convenient.
reviews.reviewText: This was my first experience with a burr grinder. I'm really impressed with the difference from my Bodum blade grinder. That works fine, too, but the Bodum burr grinder really brings out the flavor of the beans. It is so easy to use; I just put a few days supply in the top and grind what I need each day. Very easy to set the grind size and grinding time, and easy to pour out the ground beans. Easy to clean, too.

reviews.reviewTitle: I end up some fine dust and with course grinds some bits are much ...
reviews.reviewText: So much faster than the hand-cranked burr grinder I had. The grind isn't quite as consistent as I would prefer, though. On drip grinds, I end up some fine dust and with course grinds some bits are much larger than others. For my purposes and at this price point, I am a happy purchaser.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent for everyday use and small-to-medium batches of coffee
reviews.reviewText:
Compared to my previous blade griders, this burr grinder is superior in many ways, as probably most burr grinders would be. I've used it for 1 month now for my espresso machine and my drip coffee maker.

GENERAL IMPRESSSIONS: I find it grinds the beans finer compared to the commercially ground coffees I'm used to. For example, the espresso setting produces an extremely fine powder, almost like flour, which is great if that's what you want. Same with the drip filter setting - a finer grind than pre-ground store-bought coffee. The grind is completely adjustable so I just grind the beans a little coarser than the suggested settings and I'm very pleased. For drip coffee I use a reusable metal screen filter, and there is hardly any sediment at the bottom of the pot. I would imagine at the coursest setting the grind would be suitable for use in a french press.

CONCERNS ADDRESSED: I read a lot of reviews before I purchased this, so I'd like to address come concerns and criticisms other people mentioned:

GRINDING TIME LIMITATION: After 20 seconds of use you're supposed to let the machine cool down for 5 minutes before running it again. How much coffee can be ground in 20 seconds? At the espresso setting it takes about 17 seconds to grind enough for a double-shot of espresso which is all my espresso maker can handle at one time. At the drip filter setting 20 seconds grinds enough for 10 strongish cups of coffee (individual tastes will vary). I've made 12 cup pots with only 20 seconds of grinding and it was okay. You're probably not going to kill the machine if, once a month, after grinding for 20 seconds, you immediately turn it on for an extra 5 seconds. The non-english instructions do state it can run for 40 seconds straight, however the voltage is different in Europe and for all I know some of the components are different for the European models which allow them to run longer. If you often brew large pots of coffee your options are to train yourself to grind a little ahead of time using this Bodum grinder, risk burning out the motor by running it for more than 20 seconds every 5 minutes, or buy another grinder that can grind larger amounts.

INCONSITENT GRIND - I'll admit, I was expecting the grind to be as consistent as commercially purchased pre-ground coffee. It is not. There are very small amounts of fine powder mixed in with the courser grinds, but overall it is not a problem for me. The grind is much more consistent compared to my old blade grinders!!!

NOISE - This grinder is more quiet than blade grinders. It is solidly built and probably muffles noise as much as possible - which also probably prevents heat dissipation, hence the cool-down time between uses.

MESS (OR LACK THEREOF) - Bodum did an excellent job designing this grinder. No issues with static whatsoever. The flexible lid of the glass cup creates a seal with the grinder, ensuring grounds only go into the cup and not all over the place. Inevitably there will be grounds stuck up in the burrs when the machine shuts off, so if you don't give the machine a little tap before pulling the grounds cup out, some grounds may fall out inadvertantly. I see this as a consequence of using a burr grinder, and not this specific model.

Overall, I am very satisfied with this grinder and I would recommend it to friends and family.
Love it
Only been using this for about a week now but I'm very impressed. Grind is very consistent. No initial issues. Nice and quiet. Hopper holds about a half pound of coffee.
We used to have a Capresso burr grinder and it was sooooo messy. Poor product design and massive amounts of static cling. This Bodum grinder is so functional and there is absolutely no mess.

This is an ok grinder for small amounts. The issue is the longest setting runs the grinder for 20 seconds, then according to the manual, you need to wait 5 minutes before running it again. One thing that attracted me to this was the advertised lack of static cling, but that's just not true. Grounds stick to the sides of the collection cup and its top as well, ending up on the front of the grinder when you remove the collection cup.

reviews.reviewTitle: Thumbs down due to failure of minor but not replaceable part.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this less than 3 years ago and was happy with it until the last few months when the redundant start button became unreliable. It now has failed. I opened the thing and found that the switch is part of a circuit board that's hard to reach and can't be cleaned. Replacement parts are unobtainable online. The whole thing is now on the junk heap and I'm buying a different brand.

reviews.reviewTitle: Broke in under a week - but it was a great week at least
reviews.reviewText:
This is a terrific grinder in some respects - it's easy to use, the grind quality is perfect, and it doesn't spill grinds like many others I've tried. It's amazing! Except that it broke after a week...

Other reviews have noted a jamming problem that can't be fixed. I experienced the same thing.

We totally like the enhanced flavors of our coffee delivered by the grind choices and the size and capacity of the Bodum Bistro. It definitely is a major improvement over the Salton Burr grinder that we have used for some 10 or more years. No more sticking to the plastic sides with the glass container-yeah.

reviews.reviewTitle: My coffee has never tasted better
reviews.reviewText: This is a terrific, sturdy and well built coffee grinder,

I just purchased my second one of this grinder. The first one I had for 8 years and honestly I didn't ever take care of it or clean it and it still worked perfectly well. When it finally died I regretted not taking better care of it and immediately bought a replacement.
Works great, as well as machines double and triple the price.

I replaced a failing blade-style coffee grinder with the Bodum. After a month of daily use, I can say I love this grinder! Compared to the old one, it's quieter, easier to use (push the button and walk away - I don't have to hold it), more efficient - and it looks great on my counter. It requires a bit of trial-and-error to figure out how the grinding time setting correlates to actual tablespoons of ground coffee, but that was a one-time process. Other reviewers have faulted it for its delay between cycles, but as a single coffee drinker, that doesn't bother me - one cycle, six cups, and I'm done. (One thing I don't understand: why the different colors sell at different prices on Amazon.com, and change from day to day. What is up with that?)
My first burr grinder and extremely happy with every aspect of this (grind consistency, looks, ease of use). Very happy I chose to spend the extra $30 over a grinder without the metal burr.

reviews.reviewTitle: The product when it worked was great but after 3 short months it has stopped functioning
reviews.reviewText: Bought this as a gift for my aunt at Christmas 2016. The product when it worked was great but after 3 short months it has stopped functioning.

Had this for a couple of weeks only, but like it a lot. With some experimenting I can get just the right amount of grounds for the amount of water I will be using. Actually fairly quiet too. Small, well made, minimal static problems. I recommend it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not a long-lived unit…1 year…then kaput…P.O.S.
reviews.reviewText: P.O.S. Waste of time and money. The burrs are mounted to plastic clips, that snap off. Piece of junk. Also quite a bit of static, coffe adheres to the glass container. Also grinds come out of the housing which makes the whole thing a bit of a mess to deal with. I bumped up to a Breville Smart Grinder, it lasted 4 months so avoid that if you can. Finally bought and received my new Rancilio Rocky doserless grinder. I didn't want to spend the money but you do get what you pay for. So far so good, heavy consistent grind.

This unit was worthless from the start. Grinded beans perfectly the first time I used it which was a large French press grind. Upon second use, I changed the setting to a finer grind for pour over and the machine grinded for a second then seized up, stopped grinding, and made a super loud noise which sounded like something was stuck in the blades. I shook it, tapped it, brushed out the remaining ungrounded and grounded grounds then tried again with a bigger grind. Exact same thing happened.

I then followed the instructions on how to clean the grinder blades which I did and tried again. Same exact thing happened. After wasting lots of excellent coffee, I tried a dark roast and it grinded that perfectly. Thinking it had perhaps somehow fixed the problem, I again tried a light roast and once again it stopped grinding and sounded like something was stuck even though there was nothing.

I should've know when I unboxed it. It is made of cheap
plastic and feels a bit 'janky'. The only redeeming quality is that the ground catcher is made of glass....if only it'd actually grind coffee into it.

Not sure if this was a defective product but my experience was completely negative. Guess i have to keep on using my $30 hand grinder which works amazingly. What was I thinking?

Bought this on March 15, 2016. It was beautiful and worked like a charm. THREE months later after regular daily use it will no longer run. The machine will turn on but the gears won't turn. We have cleaned and cleaned and cleaned it but nothing. I wouldn't waste your money. Find a grinder that will continue to run with regular use and not just look pretty.

reviews.reviewTitle: Failed after 3.5 years of light usage
reviews.reviewText:
After 3.5 years of light usage the unit failed. It sounds like the gears between the motor and burr assembly failed.

Light usage means that I would only use it on the weekends to coarse grind (for a french press) about 8 tablespoons of coffee beans each Saturday and Sunday.

This grinder is incredible! Grinds beans with marvelous consistency and speed, without overheating or building up static thanks to the borosilicate glass receptacle. And the finish is WORLDS better than the rubberized finish on the other models, as this won't get sticky or peel or hold dirt and oil.

We have had the Bodum Bistro Burr Coffee Grinder four almost four weeks. I wish we had one sooner as it is as good as other reviews rated it. It is used at least once per day and it is easy to calibrate to your taste and type of coffee prepared. A simple wipe of the grind jar and your done.
I would recommend this grinder to anyone.
JA
Houston
Great grinder affordable price. This is a good entry burr grinder that offers fairly consistent grounds. Its elegant compact and easy to clean. Definitely reccomend
This product stopped working literally two weeks after purchasing it. We looked all over for maybe a jam or something and discovered it’s tbe motor. Would not purchase again.

I find I need to hold on to the hopper while grinding because I need the coarsest setting and the vibration of the machine while grinding tends to turn the hopper from coarse just a little further which the machine reads as "unscrew and remove" which makes it turn off. No problem. I love it.

This grinder failed after 18 months... the start button wouldn't work! This is the second Bodum grinder that failed for me with the same problem. Couldn't find the receipt so they wouldn't honor the warranty. No more Bodums for me.

reviews.reviewTitle: you can usually adjust the grind so that a very good cup of coffee can be made
reviews.reviewText: No matter what beans you have, you can usually adjust the grind so that a very good cup of coffee can be made. I hand drop my coffee and am very particular about what I will drink.

Started grinding beans in early 80's using the same grinder all these years. Have occasionaly looked for a new grinder but all I found was "blade" grinders. Then I found this STAR on Amazon and after reading several reviews I ordered one for my Son and Daughter-in-Law. when I visited them and tried it myself I immediately ordered one of my owne. Love it!! Can't imagine a better grinder for the price and size. And it's also the best way to enjoy REAL coffee. Beats all he "StarBucks", "Barnies" and whom ever out there.

Easy set up, easy to clean. Works great, our coffee does taste way better compared to a blade grinder we had previously used.

Only weird thing was the instructions. It said to empty the upper bean holder after every grind, to prevent overheating. This does not make sense since if the motor has stopped when the grinding is done, I do not see it overheating if you leave the beans there for next time. The instruction manual does need some overall work (in the translation to English).

This thing is awesome, well built and designed. A friend has had his for three years and has had zero problems. I think some people writing reviews of this item have way overstressed about cleaning it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not quite the greatest grinder, but for the $$, a fine value
reviews.reviewText: We who are members of the 99% (coffee lovers but not coffee obsessed), will appreciate this grinder as a great addition to the kitchen. Yes as others have mentioned, there is this little problem with the timer and how long one should wait between grinding beans. In this area I've found that the '20 seconds' is fine for a 6 - 8 cup drip or 2 double espressos. As there are only two of us that drink coffee in the house, this is quite adequate. The grinder itself is much quieter than its predecessor in my kitchen, is adjustable to my desired grinding levels, and gets the job done for both drip and espressos. No heat on the beans, consistency in the grind, and quite a nice looking unit make me quite pleased with my purchase. Recommend to everyone, perhaps excluding the 1%.

I have been using this grinder for about a year or so and have two minor complaints. 1) the on-light has quit working and since the switch is upside down, meaning it is on when the bottom is depressed, I frequently forget to turn it off. 2) more an observation than a complaint, under roasted beans will clog the grinder, requiring disassembly, beware.
Loud and although it has a glass container which should cut down static, the rubber piece that fits in the top causes plenty of static. It's a MESS... coffee grinds everywhere... disappointed.

Loved this grinder while it lasted... but it didn't. I only make coffee at home on weekends, and after less than 2 years the grinder suddenly "snapped" and quit working. Contacted Bodum. Unlike others here, I did get a response, but the warranty had just expired so they wouldn't do anything. Really heartbreaking to find a product you really enjoy using and having around the kitchen, then having it break with so little usage. Was going to buy another (more expensive) Bodum product, but will now go elsewhere.

Worked well for eight months but now it is making a high pitched sound and not grinding as much coffee. Now it is also not grinding to the same coarseness as the setting is set for and only grinds about half the amount specified. I hope Bodum will warranty this grinder.

Worked well for the two months, now dealing with a broken piece and the grinder has just been used 2-3 times a week with no serious volume of beans going through. Its now got some wiggle room from the broken piece and is producing a variance in ground size. Hope to get the issue solved soon.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good for Espresso if you Modify It
reviews.reviewText:
I got this for drip coffee originally then I purchased a decent espresso machine. I did some digging and you can defiantly modify the grinding settings so to get a finer espresso grind. No you don't have the control you really need but I take coffee pretty seriously and have little qualms with the way it turned out. I don't recall where i found the mod instructions but there out there. Apparently the instructions are pretty similar to the old machine as well so you can use those if you find them.

I've never used any of the Baratza machines but i hear they are good, If i'm being honest i picked the bodum based on design. if i wanted function i might have gone with the Baratza.

reviews.reviewTitle: Always works great. The static bothered me and made cleanup longer ...
reviews.reviewText: Bought mine back in 2011 and have used it most every day since. Always works great. The static bothered me and made cleanup longer than it should have been . I finally realized that I don't need the glass container and I just hold my paper filter under the grinder to catch the coffee. Grind the coffee right into the filter....makes cleanup a piece of cake!

The title for the unit should mention that it is a "conical" burr grinder, which apparently makes all the difference when it comes to noise. We purchased this unit to replace our worn out Cuisinart, which we never liked, but were not willing to replace solely because it was noisy.

The Bodum grinds with ease and the look and feel of the grinds reflects this. Grinds actually look like they came out of a commercial grinder. With our Cuisinart, the grinds always looked like they came out of the disposal.

The real test was in the first cup of coffee... We brew two cups at a time using a Chemex, so the grind duration isn't an issue. Came out tasting similar to what the coffee shop brews where we buy beans.

Amazon didn't package it well so the grounds catcher broke when I took it out of the box, but I was able to find a drinking glass that worked just great. I took the rubber ring off the top of the broken piece and put it on the glass. Works just fine. It is simple to use and grinds very, very well. I'm quite happy with it.

This is the first grinder I've ever purchsed. It was for my girlfriends birthday. It is fantastic. It grinds superr smooth. Not very noisy. and easy to use. Looks cool as well!
Being the first grinder I've used I can't compare it to any others but I would recommend it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well but makes a mess.
reviews.reviewText: So much is made of the static free glass receptical... In reality, this grider works well but makes a mess. I have grounds all over no matter what I do.
A little coffee dust but much cleaner than the brand I had before. Cleans easily and does a good job.

reviews.reviewTitle: did not verify that this grinder was in good condition. Very disappointed
reviews.reviewText:
The grinder is not working properly. The on/off button is not working correctly! Amazon, apparently, did not verify that this grinder was in good condition.
Very disappointed!!!
That’s why I give this item one star.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good for price. A little difficult to clean.
reviews.reviewText: Good grind with good options and controls. Slightly loud whir but not unbearable. Only down side is static of grinds to glass container. Gets messy around grinder.
Much better than my previous blade grinder👌

reviews.reviewTitle: So good I bought a second one!
reviews.reviewText: For the money this thing works great. The fine grind is fine enough for me. It's my second one so I had a choice of getting something else but got the same thing again. The first choked on a rock in the bag of coffee beans. Can't blame it for that and now I have a replacemention cone and extra beaker for the ground beans. Look great, too and is more compact than it appears. The cord winds up inside if it's close to an outlet.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great, but the static-proof glass is a bit of ...
reviews.reviewText: Works great, but the static-proof glass is a bit of a gimmick. It might just be the dry air in Colorado, but the coffee grounds definitely stick to the glass.
The button was broken and did not work. Expensive and not as good as our old (other manufacture) one.

Nice little grinder, simple and effective. Didn't last long-- used for 8 months grinding for about one 10 cup pot of coffee daily. Then it just slowed down, taking three times as long to grind, and with very inconsistent output, usually too coarse with big chunks of coffee beans. Took it apart, can't find anything obviously broken or worn. Tossing it out and buying a Capresso.
Great value. Stainless steel burr works great for me
Been using daily since purchase. It's held up well so far.

So far, this grinder has been a great addition to our kitchen. I worry a little bit about all of the plastic parts around the grinder but we bought an extended warranty just in case. Since we mix things up between our electric percolator, french press, and moka pot ... this grinder is going to be nice to have around!

I was thrilled to find this coffee grinder for a great price. I was concerned about the twenty second timer, we make strong coffee. It was always bitter we used about 3/4 cup of ground coffee. I was spending to much. Since buying this grinder the flavor has greatly improved, and the amount of coffee I am buying has dropped dramatically. Coffee area is very clean to do great design. We are now using these three products to make great coffeeBodum Bistro Electric Burr Coffee Grinder, BlackBodum Bistro 34-Ounce Cordless Electric Water Kettle, Black/Melitta-CoffeeMaker-CM-10-6/dp/B001MIPO78/ref=cm_cr_pr_product_top

Great for espresso, and for drip coffee too. Has held up well in near daily use. Would really like to be able to purchase an extra glass holder or two, to keep regular, decaf, espresso separated. Glass container keeps the coffee nice, does not get static and grounds flying all over the place like the old plastic mill we had before this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Much Quieter and Consistent size of grinds
reviews.reviewText: The Bodum coffee grinder is the best one I have ever had. The noise level is much lower at a lower pitch than any grinder that I have had in the past. The consistency of the size of grinds is about as good as it gets. That's important to me because we have become fans of pressed coffee. Sediment sludge in the bottom of the cup is nasty.

If you want an affordable grinder that doesn't sound like a TurboJet taking off, get this one! It is still noisy, but not as noisy as my old Cuisinart. For the money, this does a great job. I use a rounded 1/c of coffee and grind for about 16-18 seconds, well below the maximum allowed (so you do not have to worry about overheating the motor).

It looks expensive but if you want to grind your own beans at home and get a consistent and repeatable grind, every time, this is the grinder. There are better grinders out there but I only need to grind one batch once a day.

I'VE EDITED THIS REVIEW. It turns out that what I thought was the machine wearing out was actually me not reassembling the burr assembly correctly. The piece that goes down inside needs to be firmly pressed down (is the best I can describe it) to click into its track. After that, perfectly smooth, fine grind on the espresso setting!

Increasing rating to 5 stars.
~~~~~~~~~~ORIGINAL REVIEW BELOW~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've bought two of these. The first was purchased about 6 years ago and now has stopped grinding consistently--no matter how close to fine I set it, it just makes something with an inconsistent grind. The second was purchased about 10 months ago and is doing fine, but seems slightly noisier than the older one.

I've used it inconsistently, from once or twice a week to multiple times per day. I mostly grind coarse for French press coffee. Overall I am very happy with my little machines...while they work.

And the glass carafe still has static cling, no matter how much they try to prevent it. But it's not that big a deal.

reviews.reviewTitle: This grinder is worse than the cheap $12 Krups grinder that I was ...
reviews.reviewText: This grinder is worse than the cheap $12 Krups grinder that I was hoping to replace; even on the finest setting, the grind is coarser than I get using the Krups. I don't know if the product is defective, or if these grinders are just exceedingly low-quality, but I was very disappointed and have reverted to using my Krups in lieu of the Bistro.

I've been using this for the past 2 years, and I love it. It has never given me a problem, unless the coffee beans I was using were very damp (then the grinds get clogged up in the grinder, which only happened once). I would 100% recommend this grinder!

reviews.reviewTitle: It does an excellent job, and there are no coffee grounds that ...
reviews.reviewText: Buy it. It does an excellent job, and there are no coffee grounds that escape around container even on fine grind. I've had three grinders - this is the best. A little noisier than one of them, but fairly quiet. I use it for fine and coarse grind and it works great on both.
Works very well. My only complaint is that it spreads coffee grounds around it when grinding.

This burr grinder does improve the quality of your coffee significantly compared to regular blade grinder. The bur ginder does not generate the heat that adversely affects the coffee flavor and thus, better tasting coffee.

I am very pleased with the prompt delivery and service from this vendor.

I’ve had this coffee grinder for almost a year and it works great. The one negative that doesn’t apply to me is that if you use the grinder for 20 seconds, you have to let it cool for 5 minutes before using it again. I’m the only coffee drinker in my house, so the 20 second rule does not apply to me. If I needed to grind more coffee, that would be a bigger factor in my rating. That is the only reason I’m not giving this grinder 5 stars.

Yes, I would recommend this coffee grinder.

Mine literally broke within first 3 days of use

I will say that I loved the grinder while it worked. Consistent grinds, and the glass container was less static-y than some others I've used with plastic containers.

I cannot believe such a poor quality product was released for such an obscene price.
The best coffee grinder I’ve used to date. No complaints at all.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice grinder but fix the lid!
reviews.reviewText: Nice grinder but the lid should have been engineered to snap on more securely so you don't spill the unground beans from the hopper. I like the timer function.

We find that this burr grinder is far superior to the "millstone types" on the market, which we have had in the past, both in quietness and grinding speed. Though we may tend to like our coffee a bit stronger than most, we find that the longest setting on the timer - 20 seconds - is not quite long enough for a 12 cup brew. We find ourselves running a 20 second cycle, followed by a 5 second one. This pretty much fills the catch container "brim full". An effort to run it longer will guarantee a mess. As others have noted, it is best to invert the catch container with the lid on it (holding it on) over the coffeemaker basket and tap lightly on the bottom. Removing the lid will unavoidably cause a counter clean-up because of the coffee clinging to the lid from static electricity. We particularly like the large bean reservoir, giving us multiple days of coffee with one fill. The easy setting for the texture of the grind is appreciated, and once adjusted to your liking, may never need to be adjusted again. This is an excellent grinder, which we happily recommend.

This machine suddenly broke one morning. It made a high pitched whine and will not grind coffee beans anymore. The grinder does not move and there is nothing jammed in the gears. It will have to be professionally repaired which is more hassle than it's worth. I would not recommend this product.

I decided to step up to a burr grinder after I got a coffee club membership for my birthday - don't freshly ground beans just taste oh so right? This little guy has been grinding away perfectly. The grind cup is excellent - no static build up to 'hold' the coffee grinds. A little noisy, but not crazy loud.

My only complaint is a user error - I've forgotten to slide the cup in twice and ended up spewing freshly ground coffee all over my table!

This is our first coffee grinder ever. I purchased it after reading the reviews and was aware of the 20second grind time with the subsequent 5 minute cool down. My husband is the coffee drinker in the house and only drinks 1-3 cups a day which he makes one at a time in his Keurig coffee maker. The grind capacity is not an issue at all for us. Once you determine the grind time you need per cup at your preferred coarseness (which takes only a use or two)it is as simple as pushing a button. I do recommend taking 90 seconds to read the instructions, then enjoy. It is consistent and essentially mess-free. My husband loves it, and it may turn me into a coffee drinker too.

reviews.reviewTitle: Breaks before warranty and Bodum customer service may not honor
reviews.reviewText: The grinder broke before the manufacturer's warranty expired. They would not honor their warranty citing it was sold by an "Unauthorised seller". I have proof of purchase and original packaging with the 2yr warranty printed on it. The Bodum representative was short and rude. Be careful shopping on Amazon because the manufactures warranty may not apply!?!

I purchased this based on the great reviews and was not disappointed. Almost every review goes on and on about the timer being limited to 20 seconds and the fact that you have to wait 5 minutes before grinding again. In reality this is just an overly cautious note by the manufacturer, the reality is that they dont want you grinding for too long all at once.. 20 seconds is enough to grind most amounts anyway. If you need a little more, then grind a little more. I use a Bonjour Smart Brewer (1 or 2 cup) drip maker. I set the grinder for about 5 seconds and press the button once and i get the perfect amount of grinds that i can just dump in the coffee maker. It streamlines the process and avoids the problem of grinding too much or too little. Love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: I was seduced by the beautiful design. But
reviews.reviewText: I was seduced by the beautiful design. But, about two months after using daily and feeling good, a bean got stuck in the burr (thats where its supposed to go) and now it doesn't grind the bean except super course even on the finest setting.. and since it's a few days after the 30 dat amazon allotted period i'm stuck with this junk

I bought this grinder almost 3 months ago. So far, I love this thing! I was convinced to sit down and write a review when a large pebble passed under my eye and into my grinder. The burr wasn't even phased by it! I did have to get needle-nose pliers to pry it out; but my grinder still remains fully functional with the bare hint that a rock passed through it. The grinds are even throughout, and do well for a french press, drip machine, or pour-over. I wouldn't recommend it for espresso though. Aside from the great functionality, it looks really nice too. I definitely recommend it for any pour-over fans. ~ 4-year home coffee roaster, 3-year barista, 10-year coffee enthusiast

reviews.reviewTitle: Our second one just wish there were parts we could ...
reviews.reviewText: Our second one just wish there were parts we could buy instead of replacing whole unit but it last quite a while

reviews.reviewTitle: ... previously that died after I think a year but liked it so much I thought I'd give it another ...
reviews.reviewText: I had one of these previously that died after I think a year but liked it so much I thought I'd give it another chance. It's the perfect home grinder and hopefully will last a little longer this time...

reviews.reviewTitle: Failed at 6 months. (also: Doesn't grind fine enough for espresso)
reviews.reviewText:
Very cute design, but failed at after a little under 6 months light use (5-6 grinds for a single espresso per week).

Also, doesn't really grind fine enough for espresso (using Breville dual boiler to pull the espresso).

When our 23 year old blade coffee grinder finally gave in we decided to upgrade to a burr grinder and finally settled on this. While it lasted it did a fair job of grinding coffee but there are a couple of issues that you need to be aware of;

- Loud, like in you cant have a conversation while this thing is running loud
- Walks, there's a fair amount of torque on start up which causes the unit to spin every time you start it, not a big deal but annoying nonetheless
- Cant easily adjust grind, you have to empty the beans from the unit to adjust the grind

and lastly it only lasted 13 months. It looks like the circuit board failed because I traced the power to that and then nothing. It uses a small micro switch and those typically are reliable so it's probably a burned out transistor or diode. What a shame a $120 unit is rendered inoperable (and non repairable) by a 20 cent component, this is a major design flaw.

I’ve had this grinder for several weeks. As has been mentioned, it took a couple of tries to find the right grind – the ‘espresso’ setting was too fine for the water to get through on my (De’Longhi) machine. Other than that it’s a GREAT grinder – really easy to use and a lot quieter than others I have had. I especially like the nearly air tight way the receiving glass carafe fits into the machine. As to why I bought the grinder might be TMI but I’ll share it anyway ;o)... Peet’s coffee has been my absolute favorite for many years. I was in Chicago recently and my friend took me into an Intelligentsia coffee shop where I had a Black Cat cappuccino – WOW – sorry Peet’s but I am now getting it (whole bean) through the mail!
