I am so hooked now, you couldn't get me back to packaged coffee again. What a difference for me to be drinking freshly ground coffee and I just love it. The Bodum Bistro Electric Burr Coffee Grinder is easy to use and I found it relatively quiet (in spite of other reviews on here). The coffee is ground evenly and smoothly and the aroma from the ground beans is amazing. I love this grinder!

reviews.reviewTitle: but this one definitely one of the BEST ones out there
reviews.reviewText: I've purchased other coffee grinders, but this one definitely one of the BEST ones out there. Love the sleek look, its compact, and easy to use.

Perfect coffee grinder. Tap on the sides after grinding to keep all the grinds neatly in the glass jar.

Easy to clean, quiet, consistent grind.

reviews.reviewTitle: looks as good as it works
reviews.reviewText: Grinds to perfection with a minimum of fuss and muss. Even very dark roast, which clogged my last grinder, goes thru effortlessly. Highly recommend.

i did a comparison with two items, the capresso infinite and this, did the finest grind for each and saw that the bodum did a better finer grind than the capresso.

in addition, although its not too fine to be so called powdery thus it makes a better grind for pressurized portafilters.

Used it once a day &, except for excessive static build up, it worked adequately. However, after 6 months, during my morning ritual of making coffee I heard a "CLUNK" & the grinder quit working. After removing the resevoir I discovered the plastic housing of the burr had shattered. Rather than going thru the hassle of returning it for repair & because of lack of trust that it would last a respectable amount of time, I tossed it.

I learned that one of the best burr coffee grinders is the Bodum Bistro Electric Burr Coffee Grinder.
I have been very satisfied with this burr grinder. Works great. Versitile, efficient, good grinder.

Have owned this now for 5 months. The grind works great, but I agree that you need to do multiple 20 second bursts to get enough for a pot of coffee. The mess it creates is about normal for a counter top unit, so expect some. The biggest problem is the container for catching the grounds. It's glass and comes out of the holder area very easily. So, it only took a few months, and when lifting it up to clean up the mess the container falls out and shatters. Bad design (also stupid me for not taking it out first, I know). They should have foreseen that this was a very likely event and made the container out of something that doesn't send shards of glass all over the counter when dropped from 4 inches. Also, a little on the loud side, so if someone gets up early to make coffee it can wake up others in the home. Overall, it does a good job, but I would not buy it again due to the flaw in the glass catch container.
I liked this machine while it worked, hence the two stars instead of one. However it died almost three years to the day after I bought it. That seems too short of a life-span given the cost.

I have used this daily for about 6 months and it works well. I have it on the finest grind for my La Pavoni lever machine and it is the right grind if I use the right beans. The maximum 20 second timer grinds enough for two shots. Other than a manual grinder, I don't think this can be beat for the price.

I would not recommend this product!!

Maybe it is great for french press users or single cup drinkers, and it is probably our fault for not reading and understanding the 20 second run time. While many are saying the first 20 seconds works fine, we are not finding that to be true. We DO NOT EVEN get the FULL 20 seconds on the FIRST BUTTON PUSH. The timing is very inconsistent which makes every pot hit or miss each morning. My husband will use his watch to time it so he knows how to adjust the timing for the correct amount; however, I WILL NOT DO THIS EVERY MORNING (life is too short plus I don't own a watch) and if we are to wait five minutes between short spurts, again life is too short. For example, this morning my husband had it SET FOR 20 seconds and ONLY GOT 7 seconds and a second push got him almost 10 seconds and tried again which now gave him the 20 seconds. At least two out of three times it gives you less seconds than what is selected. This results in varying amounts of ground coffee each morning...too weak or too strong and rarely perfect.

My other issue is as another reviewer stated, the static is NOT better; it is about the same. I even find the static to be MESSIER than our old plastic container. When you go to pull the container out, there is always a clump that falls out onto the grinder platform/plate. You go to wipe it up and as soon as you touch the platform more falls out. Then, when you take the cover off the glass container to tap into your drip brewer basket, it sprays and much of the ground beans stick inside the glass. It is difficult to get this amount out and every bit of ground beans are needed since you cannot get enough to grind in the first place.

We have been using this grinder for a little more than a month and I am tired of not knowing which mornings I will get a good cup of coffee. It is not worth the cost even at a very discounted price of $60. Unfortunately, we are just past the 30 days to return it and are now stuck with it.

The only good thing about this grinder is we find we are using less coffee!! Now that I am cheated of a good cup of coffee every morning, maybe I will give up my only vice and switch to green tea!

Started a groupgift for myself on VenTribe.com; Love this product. I love fresh coffee, I love grinding my own beans, This was a great gift. Works smoothly. I've had it for six months and not one issue. Make sure you clean it regularly and you should have zero issues!

reviews.reviewTitle: Broke Within 7 Months and Warranty Not Honored
reviews.reviewText: I used this grinder for about 7 months and then it stopped grinding as much coffee even on the same grind time. I assumed the gears were somehow breaking. Finally it stopped working completely. Unfortunately Bodum didn't honor their warranty. The grinder was fine for the time I had it, but I am very disappointed with the costumer service.

I shop carefully and pay attention to consumer reviews. When I bought some Kopi Luwak at $80 for 1/4 lb. I wanted a top-rated established (affordable) burr grinder for the best grind possible. So when I read the generally glowing reviews of the Bistro on this site and ordered it for myself, I wonder, "Did I get a lemon?" No matter what setting I use, the finest espresso grind or the coarsest french press grind, all the coffee comes out extremely fine. As in dust - as in cakes together like flour. I have tried a couple of different beans and roasts and I get the same results. At the coarsest setting I get some additional larger chunks mixed in with the espresso-type grind but that's about it. If I try this in my press I will get coffee soup. I am having it replaced as defective with the same model and I hope there is just something wrong with this first one, but we'll see. I will update after I try the replacement. I contacted the Bodum customer service twice by email but have received no response despite a promise that all emails will be answered in 24 hours. Meanwhile, I will keep shopping for another brand in case my second Bodum works no better than the first.
Also, I am curious about the 20 second limit for grinding to prevent overheating, because I happened to notice in the manual's non-English sections several other languages that specify a 40 second max. I would take the 20 second rule with a grain of salt and do a 30 - 40 second grind without too much fear, then let it cool. That's just me.
UPDATE: I received my replacement and tried the coarse and fine grinds and this unit appears to be better. The fine grind is definitely a consistent, fine texture that should work well for espresso, but the coarse grind still looks a bit finer than what I'm used to seeing from my roasting shop when I request coffee for a french press. Nevertheless, I will keep this one and upgrade it to four stars.
Spectacular grind setting, getting as coarse or as fine as you want. The fine grind is about as fine as the ground Illy coffee.

I purchased this grinder a few months ago so I could have a grinder with specific grind settings. This grinder grinds the beans well with a great motor. However, after the grind is done, about a half scoop to a whole scoop of ground coffee always gets stuck in the chamber. You need to shake the unit to get all of the coffee out. As a result, there is a mess to clean each time. I called Bodum customer service twice. The first answer I got was I was using oily beans,(eight o'clock), she recommended Starbucks. I bought the Starbucks and I am still having the problem. I called Bodum again and was told this was a normal thing for the ground coffee to get stuck. If anybody has any ideas or recommendations for me to help me grind my coffee without the ground coffee mess, I am all ears.
Received it as a gift. After about 5 uses the grinder would seize. Worked perfectly the first few times, and now it's useless.
I purchased this based on the great reviews and was not disappointed.It streamlines the process and avoids the problem of grinding too much or too little. Love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worst bean grinder I've ever purchased.
reviews.reviewText:
It is impossible to grind enough coffee for 10 cups in one shot. The grinder shuts down after 5-20 seconds so you must repeat this about 5 times to get enough coffee for one pot. The static is horrible so you are left with coffee grounds all over the counter and your hands.
Do not waste your money. I put mine out with the garbage.

I cannot believe anyone likes this grinder! I bought it on the strength of the reviews I read, after my Baratza grinder was melted by lightning....the grind is fine, but the timer is a pain, and static is worse than the plastic container on the Baratza!
If you have much coffee to grind, do yourself a favor, and look elswhere.
